CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 6, 1967, pg. 1 reads: "Wallace Incident, Prompt action by Police prevented two identified men from entering the 17th floor Ballroom of the Penn-Sheraton Hotel during the appearance of George c. Wallace, guest speaker at eh Amen Corner Dinner. Tight Police security was clamped around and in hotel, but these two men slipped through.  They were quietly escorted from the hotel.  Another incident involved New Courier photographer Teenie Harris, whose camera was nearly knocked from his has hand by an Amen Corner member.  Harris was attempting to take pictures of Wallace and Marshall, president of the club. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Former Alabama Governor George Wallace, and another man, possibly Houston Marshall, wearing tuxedo, walking in the hallway of the Penn Sheraton Hotel
CatSubject_tab: Wallace, George C. (George Corley), 1919-Men--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Penn Sheraton Hotel (Pittsburgh, Pa.)
